alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 4:34AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ANOTHER ROUND OF SNOW AND POTENTIAL MIXED PRECIPITATION EXPECTED ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST TODAY AND MONDAY... An active pattern will continue over the Southwest as another strong pressure system moves north into the Kuskokwim Delta and Bristol Bay later today into Monday. A mix of rain, snow and potentially a short period of freezing rain and sleet will progress north as the low moves inland through Monday afternoon, with the highest potential for higher snowfall amounts of 3 to 8 inches focused near the Kuskokwim Mountains and Kuskokwim Delta Coast. Snow may mix with or fully change to rain farther east over much of Bristol Bay and the Middle Kuskokwim Valley, limiting snowfall totals. The threat for significant freezing rain within the transition zone is low, with little to no ice accumulation expected. However, there is remaining uncertainty for where this transition will develop and how quickly temperatures will warm through Monday morning.
